Definition.WordDefinition:
Constantly \Con"stant*ly\, adv. With constancy; steadily; continually; perseveringly; without cessation; uniformly. [1913 Webster]
But she constantly affirmed that it was even so. --Acts. xii. 15. [1913 Webster] ||

constantly adv 1: seemingly uninterrupted; "constantly bullied by his big brother"; "was perpetually answering the doorbell" [syn: {perpetually}] 2: without variation or change; "constantly kind and gracious" 3: without interruption; "the world is constantly changing"
